DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version Global Executive Composite T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Global Executive Composite in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Preschool Version Global Executive Composite T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to specifically measure executive function in children aged 2 to 5 years. Parents, teachers, or other caregivers rate a child's executive functions within the context of the child's home or preschool environments._An overall index of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function which takes into account all of the clinical scales and represents the individual's overall executive function._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Preschool Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to specifically measure executive function in children aged 2 to 5 years. Parents, teachers, or other caregivers rate a childÂ¿s executive functions within the context of the child's home or preschool environments.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Preschool Version
Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale designed to specifically measure executive function in children aged 2 to 5 years. Parents, teachers, or other caregivers rate a child's executive functions within the context of the child's home or preschool environments.

Property.preferredDefinition: An overall index of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function which takes into account all of the clinical scales and represents the individual's overall executive function.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: An overall index of the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function which takes into account all of the clinical scales and represents the individual's overall executive function.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BRIEF-P:Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Preschool Version. Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Kimberly Andrews Espy, PhD, and Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, Lutz, FL, 2003
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 4/2/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
